title: Someone explain to me why 5 minutes of deciding a winner followed by 15 minutes of snowball is fun
body:
Nexus Blitz has so many opportunities for a team to get stronger that games are pretty much decided by 3-5 minutes. After that, it's a long slog of pointless battles and events with no mystery or surprise when the stronger team wins again. It's not fun or exciting being on either end of this.

And why do ~40% of players either not understand this, or enjoy being stomped? Why vote no on a forfeit if your team is down by 30 kills and has lost every single event? Someone please explain what's enjoyable about walking around for a few seconds and then dying within 1 second, with those times just getting shorter as the game goes on.

replies.body: Comebacks are possible if you can reach Sudden Death, by then it's usually anyones game. There's been so many games I've won while behind the entire game, defending until sudden death then just winning there, despite being stuck in our base until then. I have also lost games that way, while being like 19/1 but we just couldn't end and they played sudden death better.
